intro: Scurrula indica, commonly known as the Indian scurrula, is a flowering plant native to southern and eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a fern-like appearance. Scurrula indica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks.
